intro: Centropogon bruneotomentosus, commonly known as the Bruneo-tomentous centropogon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for taxonomic study and ecological research.
